Description: Rim sherd of North Ionian pottery eye cup; interior black with band in added red lined in white; top of rim glazed; exterior: from left, group of four tapering vertical black bars; to right, part of eyebrow and eye with star as filling ornament; below, two black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The accession number on the sherd reads only H2779, 'c' has been added as there are seven other sherds with the same number. For parallels, see Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA4 and British Museum 1886,0401.1037.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.245)
